head.supplied: ¶ The 6½ reams of lithogr. paper are for the Gov Botanist's Department, and form the remainder of an order, by which the balance of a former vote for this purpose, transmitted to the Agent General wi...

div.p: 82/R3598, unit 931, VPRS 1207/P000 inward registered correspondence, VA 865 Department of the Treasurer, Public Record Office, Victoria.

The 6½ reams of lithogr. paper are for the Gov Botanist's Department, and form the remainder of an order, by which the balance of a former vote for this purpose, transmitted to the Agent General will be consumed. I shall be glad, if the Gov. Printer will keep this paper in store, to be available for the next decades of the Eucal. Atlas.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
82/132
Memorandum written on back of letter from John Ferres to Edward Symonds, 16 March 1882, concerning the invoice for the plate paper. The file was referred to M by Symonds on 17 March 1882. For previous correspondence concerning this batch of plate paper, see M to W. Odgers, 31 January 1881, T. Wilson to M, 2 August 1881 (in this edition as 81-08-02a), and M to T. Wilson, 6 August 1881 (in this edition as 81-08-06a). See also E. Symonds to M, 27 April 1882 (in this edition as 82-04-27b).
Annotations: 'The Government Printer will please note | E. S. Symonds | Under Treasurer | 21/3/82', and 'Noted and returned | J. Ferres | Govt. Printer | 23.3.82'.
